result.execSummary:
The defendant Faryn M. Dacquisto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Faryn M. Dacquisto is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Faryn M. Dacquisto was found guilty of Burglary-Room w/in Building, etc. [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(f).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).
** Pay restitution plus surcharges. Restitution hearing before Comm Dowse.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Particiapte and complete AODA treatment as deemed appropriate by the Compass Assessment and DOC.  Mental Health treatmet and follow all recommended treatment.  Notify all doctors of your drug history.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Matthew Perz.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Sentencing arguments made.  Count 1- DE is sentenced to 5 years in the WSP consecutive to any other sentence; 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years Extended Supervision with conditions.  State is requesting restitution in the amounts of $12,395.38 & 14,544.46 and Atty Perz requests a restitution hearing.   Restitution shall be determined through a restitution hearing before Comm. Dowse.  DE is eligible for CIP & SAP.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Sentencing hearing on May 21, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Atty Perz requests sentencing be moved out to end of May to allow DE time to complete program.  Sentencing on 5/21/15 at 10:30 AM confirmed with Atty Perz.

Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  Count 1 - Deft. pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 2 & 3 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 2/20/15 at 11:00 AM.
